communications.subject: FOIA Request Status Update
communications.communication:
Good Day, Mr. Neiss - 
The documents collected in response to your FOIA request were sent on 12/01/2021 to the Office of the Secretary of Defense's (OSD) FOIA program office for mandatory review.  Review of the documents by the OSD FOIA office is mandatory due to the high visibility, sensitive nature of the documents and any potential for national security content.  The documents will be routed back to the Commander Navy Installations Command FOIA program upon completion of the OSD FOIA review process. 
Our office is not able to give you an estimated completion date of the OSD FOIA review at this time.  Upon receipt of the documents in our office, they will be processed for release to you as expeditiously as possible.  Your continued patience is requested and appreciated as the review process continues forward.   I will contact you when I have more info concerning the completion of the OSD FOIA review process. 
Please do not hesitate to contact our office if you have any questions or concerns.  Thank you. 
Respectfully, 
Patricia Williams-Butler 
FOIA Coordinator 
Commander Navy Installations Command Office of General Counsel 
Washington Navy Yard, DC

communications.subject: FOIA Request DON-NAVY-2022-001711
communications.communication:
Good Day, Mr. Neiss - 
The assigned FOIA request tracking number, DON-NAVY-2022-001711, remains the same throughout the document review process and regardless of the agency reviewing responsive documents. 
The documents collected in response to your FOIA request were sent on 12/01/2021 to the Office of the Secretary of Defense's (OSD) FOIA Program Office for mandatory review.  Review of the documents by the OSD FOIA office is mandatory due to the high visibility, sensitive nature of the documents and any potential for national security content.  As of 07/27/2022, the documents remian in the possesion of the OSD FOIA office for completion of its mandatory review.  Upon completion, the documents will be routed back to the Commander Navy Installations Command FOIA program office to be processed for release to you. 
Unfortunately, our office is not able to give you an estimated completion date of the OSD FOIA review at this time.  Upon receipt of the documents in our office from the OSD FOIA office, they will be processed for release to you as expeditiously as possible.  Your continued patience is requested and appreciated as the review process continues forward. 
Due to lengthiness of the mandatory OSD review process, you are advised you have the option of withdrawing your FOIA request. The CNIC FOIA Program office IS NOT instructing or recommending you withdraw your request but only informing you of your option to do so.  If you desire to withdraw your FOIA request, please do so in writing via a reply to this correspondence within 30 days. 
Our office will continue to keep you informed of the status of your request. 
Thank you. 
Respectfully, 
Patricia Williams-Butler 
FOIA Coordinator 
Commander Navy Installations Command 
Office of General Counsel 
Washington Navy Yard, DC

communications.subject: DON-NAVY-2022-001711
communications.communication:
Good Day, Mr. Neiss - 
Our office notified you on 08/30/2022 documents collected in response to your FOIA request were sent on 12/01/2021 to the Office of the Secretary of Defense's (OSD) FOIA Program Office for mandatory review.  Review of the documents by the OSD FOIA office is mandatory due to the high visibility, sensitive nature of the documents and any potential for national security content.  As of 08/30/2022, the documents remain in the possesion of the OSD FOIA office for completion of its mandatory review. 
You were also advised due to lengthiness of the mandatory OSD review process, you have the option of withdrawing your FOIA request. 
Should you desire to continue forward with the FOIA request, our office will keep you informed of the status of your request.  Upon receipt of the documents in our office from the OSD FOIA office, they will be processed for release to you as expeditiously as possible. If you desire to withdraw your FOIA request, please do so in writing via a reply to this correspondence within 30 days, on or before 10/14/2022. 
If our office does not receive a written response informing us of your intentions to continue forward with the request or withdraw your FOIA request, your request will be administratively closed without further action. 
CNIC FOIA Program Office, Washington Navy Yard, DC

Good afternoon Mr. Neiss,

 

I am the Temporary FOIA Coordinator at Commander, Navy Installations Command
(CNIC). I am writing regarding your FOIA request DON-NAVY-2022-001711.

in case anything has changed and if you are no longer interested in pursuing
this request, please kindly let me know.

address below.

Elizabeth Retter

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #DON-NAVY-2022-001711
communications.communication:
Good evening Mr. Neiss,



Thank you for forwarding this. Unfortunately, from what I can see, your 
requested documents are still in the possession of the OSD FOIA office for 
mandatory review.  The same day I reached out to you, I also reached out to 
the Department of the Navy Office of the Chief of Naval Operations 
FOIA/Privacy Act Program (DNS 36), in order to request an update about your 
case. I have not heard back yet.



If you would like to contact them directly, their email address is: 
usn.ncr.dns.mbx.don-foia-pa@us.navy.mil 
<mailto:usn.ncr.dns.mbx.don-foia-pa@us.navy.mil> . Their phone number is 
202-685-0412.  Please note that they do not hold your records (OSD does) but 
they should be able to get an update from OSD for you.



I will also let you know as soon as I hear back from them.



There is not much CNIC can do while the records are with OSD, but once we 
receive your records from OSD, we will process them as expeditiously as 
possible.



In the meantime, please do not hesitate to contact me, and thank you for your 
patience in this process.



V/R,



Elizabeth Retter

LCDR, JAGC, USNR

Temporary FOIA Coordinator

Commander, Navy Installations Command

Email:   <mailto:elizabeth.v.retter.mil@us.navy.mil>

communications.subject: RE: [Non-DoD Source] RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #DON-NAVY-2022-001711
communications.communication:
Good morning,

 

Your requested documents are still in the possession of the OSD FOIA office for mandatory review. You can also reach out directly to Department of the Navy Office of the Chief of Naval Operations FOIA/Privacy Act Program (DNS 36), in order to request an update about your case via email at: usn.ncr.dns.mbx.don-foia-pa@us.navy.mil <mailto:usn.ncr.dns.mbx.don-foia-pa@us.navy.mil>  <mailto:usn.ncr.dns.mbx.don-foia-pa@us.navy.mil> or via phone at 202-685-0412. 

 

Please note that they (DNS 36) do not hold your records (OSD does), but they should be able to get an update from OSD for you.

 

There is nothing CNIC can do while the records are with OSD, but once we receive your records from OSD, we will process them as expeditiously as possible.

 

We thank you for your continued patience.

 

 

Respectfully,

Michelle Cador

Management Analyst/Paralegal

FOIA Coordinator

Office of the General Counsel

716 Sicard Street SE, Suite 207

Washington Navy Yard, DC 20374-5140

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Electronic Communications Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Electronic communications (to include e-mail, “Classdojo” messages, or any other form of electronic messages) between Paige Locke (paigeorama707@gmail.com and  paigelocke707@gmail.com) and Brevard Public Schools employee Ashley Tubbs (Tubbs.Ashley@brevardschools.org) for the period of 10/1/2022 until date of production

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Michael Locke

RE:          Acknowledgement of Records Request                  Ticket ID# 24-676


Dear Michael Locke,
We have received your public records request.

Your request will be processed in accordance with the Florida Public Records Law.

Please be advised there are potentially fees to cover the cost of reproduction, including copier expenses, supplies and staff time associated with all requests.  You will be advised as soon as possible regarding estimated costs.  Payment will be due in advance by check or money order made payable to the School Board of Brevard County.  If the actual cost is more than the estimate, your records will be released when payment in full has been received.  If the actual cost is less than the estimate, a check for reimbursement will be requested and mailed to you.

PLEASE NOTE: Not all completed public records are in a digitized format.  To receive a digitized version of a redacted record may require additional time and resources, resulting in additional expense.

You will be notified if records are exempt from public disclosure.  Under public records laws, the district is not obliged to create a new document or records in response to a request for public records.  Likewise, the district will not acquire computer software for the sole purpose of providing access or delivery of public records that are accessible by other means.

If you have any questions, please contact me at recordsrequest@brevardschools.org<mailto:recordsrequest@brevardschools.org>.

Holly Christmas
Florida Certified Records Manager
Brevard Public Schools
Division of Government and Community Relations
2700 Judge Fran Jamieson Way
Viera, FL  32940
321 633-1000 x11453
[BPSLogoColor]
You can't change the past, but you can ruin the present by worrying about the future.

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request #24-676
communications.communication:
Thank you for your response. To clarify, I submitted this request in my personal capacity as a parent, not on behalf of MuckRock or for any commercial purpose. Under the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA), as a parent I have a right to access my child's educational records, which includes communications between school staff that relate to my child.

Please let me know if you need any additional information from me to process this request, such as a copy of my ID or custody paperwork demonstrating my parental rights. I would be happy to provide that documentation. If there are any fees associated with searching for or copying these records, please inform me before fulfilling my request.

I understand you must comply with FERPA, but that law also ensures parental access to student records, with limited exceptions. FERPA requires redacting personally identifiable information about other students, but communications relating to my child should be provided to me, with appropriate redactions if needed.

If any responsive records are located, I would prefer to receive them electronically via email if possible, to avoid copying costs. If records are withheld or redacted, please cite the specific statutory exemption that forms the basis for the denial and advise me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Thank you in advance for your assistance with my request. Please let me know if you have any questions or need further information from me.

Sincerely,
Michael Locke

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request #24-676
communications.communication:
Given your role in the Office of Legal Services, I’m seeking clarification regarding district policy on recommending school-based counseling for a student who, according to official school records, displays no behavioral or academic concerns in school and is described as a role model to her peers.

As a parent, I am curious about how such a recommendation aligns with district procedures, particularly in a Title 1 school setting where resources are often allocated based on immediate, school-related needs. Specifically, I’d appreciate insight into:

	1.	District Procedures and Resource Allocation: What is the district’s stance on using Title 1 resources, like school-based counseling, for students who do not display in-school issues? How is this type of intervention typically justified and documented in such cases?
	2.  Compliance and Liability: Could recommending school-based counseling under these circumstances pose any compliance or liability concerns for the district, particularly if the recommendation is based on observations outside of the school environment?

Thank you for your time and assistance in clarifying the district’s policy on these matters. I look forward to your guidance on how this aligns with established procedures and legal obligations.

Best regards,
Michael Locke

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request #24-676
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Christmas,

I am writing to request information pursuant to the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA), 20 U.S.C. § 1232g, regarding a specific conference note dated March 7, 2024, associated with my child, Rowen Locke, who attends Sabal Elementary School.

The document in question pertains to a parent-requested meeting attended by Paige Locke, Ashley Tubbs (now Mrs. Woltman), and Debra Pollard. While the note reflects the meeting date of March 7, 2024, it does not indicate the date and time when the note was actually created or entered into the school’s record-keeping system.

I was informed of this meeting only after it had occurred and subsequently spoke with Ms. Tubbs (now Mrs. Woltman) via ClassDojo. In that conversation, I expressed my views on the subjects discussed during the meeting; however, these views were not reflected in the conference note. To ensure complete transparency and accuracy in my child’s educational records, I am requesting the following under FERPA:

	1.	Initial Entry Date and Time: Documentation or metadata showing when the March 7, 2024, conference note was first entered or saved in your electronic records system.
	2.	Audit Trail: An audit log or record of access, including any modifications, views, or retrievals of this document, along with the associated dates and times. This information will help verify when and by whom the document has been accessed or modified within the school’s system.
	3.	Explanation of Record Creation Process: Any policies or procedures relating to how records like conference notes are entered, saved, and generated from your system, specifically addressing any delays between the meeting date and the creation date of the document.

As a parent with rights to review and access my child’s educational records under FERPA, I am seeking this information to verify the accuracy and integrity of the documentation in Rowen’s records. I would appreciate a prompt response within the time frame required under FERPA regulations, and I am open to receiving these records in electronic format via email.

If there are any fees associated with providing these records, please inform me in advance. Should you require further clarification or additional information to process this request, feel free to contact me at the phone number or email address provided above.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response.

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request #24-676
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Christmas,
Pursuant to my records request #24-676, I am attaching an email chain regarding a March 7, 2024 Zoom meeting concerning Rowen Locke. The chain includes:

March 4, 2024 11:48 AM email from Paige Locke to Mrs. Tubbs
March 4, 2024 12:43 PM response from Mrs. Tubbs
March 4, 2024 6:48 PM confirmation from Paige Locke

Could you please confirm whether this is a true and accurate copy of the educational record maintained by Brevard Public Schools?
Thank you for your assistance.
Best regards,
Michael Locke

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request Locke-PRR-#25-389
communications.communication:
Good Morning,

We have received your records request.

Your request will be processed in accordance with the Florida Public Records Law.

Please be aware The School Board of Brevard County, Florida is not a covered entity under HIPAA and therefore Directive Letter/HITECH Act.42 is not applicable. The School Board of Brevard County as a political subdivision of the State of Florida, is required to comply with Florida Statutes in response to its responsibility to comply with requests for public records, particularly, Section 119.07, Florida Statutes, titled Inspection and copying for records; photographing public records: fees: exemptions.

Please be advised there are potentially fees to cover the cost of reproduction, including copier expenses, supplies and staff time associated with all requests.  You will be advised as soon as possible regarding estimated costs.  Payment will be due in advance by check or money order made payable to the School Board of Brevard County.  If the actual cost is more than the estimate, your records will be released when payment in full has been received.  If the actual cost is less than the estimate, a check for reimbursement will be requested and mailed to you.

PLEASE NOTE: Not all completed records are in a digitized format.  To receive a digitized version of a redacted record may require additional time and resources, resulting in additional expense.

You will be notified if records are exempt from disclosure.  Under public records laws, the district is not obliged to create a new document or records in response to a request for public records.  Likewise, the district will not acquire computer software for the sole purpose of providing access or delivery of records that are accessible by other means.

If you have any questions, please contact me at recordsrequest@brevardschools.org<mailto:recordsrequest@brevardschools.org>.
Holly Christmas
Florida Certified Records Manager
Office of Legal Services
Brevard County Public Schools
2700 Judge Fran Jamieson Way
Viera, FL  32940
321 633-1000 x11453
[BPSLogoColor]
You can’t change the past, but you can ruin the present by worrying about the future.

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Agency Roster (Orlando Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Traffic Stop Records (Department of Transportation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Public Records Law, G.L., c. 66, § 10, I hereby request the following records:

all data, including statistical information, collected from any Massachusetts Uniform Citation (“MUC”) issued in the Commonwealth between January 1, 2021 and May 2024.

Some important fields may include: 

City of Boston Employee ID (6 digit ID)
Employee first name
Employee last name
Employee middle name
Badge Number
Rank
District/Taskforce
Date of Stop
Time of Stop
Location of stop
Latitude/longitude
Race of driver
Gender of driver
Age of driver
If search occurred
If contraband was found,

I also request a waiver of all fees for this request, as disclosure of the requested information to me is in the public interest and will contribute to the public’s understanding of operations and activities of the government. This request is being made for research conducted by Spark! at Boston University and will not be used for commercial use.

I expect the request to be filled in an electronically-accessible format, including for screen readers, excel, or CSV. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents. We understand that the data may be large in size, so feel free to send it over in year or half-year increments.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. If you believe any of this information to be exempt, I ask you to please cite the specific portion of the law on which you rely. I also ask you to please redact any information you believe to be exempt and disclose the rest. If you need to discuss this request, I can be reached at 617-358-8514.

Sincerely,
Boston University SPARK!

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Eugenio Rolando Martinez
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of your agency's files on Miami resident Eugenio Rolando Martinez, convictrd Watergate burglar and former CIA informant. Martinez was on July 8, 1922. He died on January 30, 2021. 

See "Eugenion Martinez," WIkipedia, https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eugenio_Mart%C3%ADnez.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events 

As a career journalist and regular contributor to national news sites like Just Security, Counterpunch, and The Intercept,  I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the CIA and FBI and its activities for the Washington Post, Slate, Salon, the New Republic, and the Nation, so I have a reasonable expectation of publication.  

Additionally, courts have held that the news media status "focuses on the nature of the requester, not its request. The provision requires that the request be “made by” a representative of the news media. Id. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). A newspaper reporter, for example, is a representative of the news media regardless of how much interest there is in the story for which he or she is requesting information." As such, the details of the request itself are moot for the purposes of determining the appropriate fee category. As such, my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting on it and making the released files available to the public. I therefore request that fees be waived.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Jeff Morley

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jefferson Morley

    See "Eugenion Martinez," WIkipedia,
    https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eugenio_Mart%C3%ADnez.
    
    Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not
    limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone
    Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and
    the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and
    cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant
    names, agencies, organizations, companies and events
    
    As a career journalist and regular contributor to national news sites like
    Just Security, Counterpunch, and The Intercept, I am a member of the news
    media and request classification as such. I have previously written about
    the CIA and FBI and its activities for the Washington Post, Slate, Salon,
    the New Republic, and the Nation, so I have a reasonable expectation of
    publication.
    
    Additionally, courts have held that the news media status "focuses on the
    nature of the requester, not its request. The provision requires that the
    request be “made by” a representative of the news media. Id. §
    552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). A newspaper reporter, for example, is a representative
    of the news media regardless of how much interest there is in the story for
    which he or she is requesting information." As such, the details of the
    request itself are moot for the purposes of determining the appropriate fee
    category. As such, my primary purpose is to inform about government
    activities by reporting on it and making the released files available to the
    public. I therefore request that fees be waived.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Jefferson Morley
    
    Upload documents directly:
    https://https://www.muckrock.comhttps://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Feugenio-rolando-martinez-107757%252F%253Femail%253Defoia%252540subscriptions.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2O3FGiSDXH3mORgxvQEAgVs%3A1l78Ke%3AHi155F1Cvywtl4b3_9FnE0pJwwc

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1489282-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 104 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 853 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,786 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,500 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

COVID-19 Impact: RIDS resumed full staffing on April 12, 2021.  Commensurate with the return of full staffing levels, RIDS will being increasing its FOIA processing production.  While RIDS will make its best efforts to meet increased production goals, this increased production rate may be negatively impacted by COVID-19 workplace disruptions.  As a result, estimated dates of completion for Freedom of Information Act requests were impacted and you can expect lengthened response timelines.  Please note that these are estimates, and these timelines may change as this national emergency evolves.  The FBI remains committed to fulfilling your FOIPA request in the timeliest manner possible.   Thank you for your patience and understanding.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1489282-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for your inquiry regarding the status of your Freedom of Information Act/Privacy (FOIPA) request.   A review of your request has determined the following:

The request is presently awaiting assignment to a Disclosure analyst who will then review the records to determine if any redactions are required pursuant to subsections of Title 5, U. S. Code, Section 552 and 552a.

You may check the status of your request online at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request’ link. Online status reports are updated weekly.

Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks-simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into small, medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track extra-small requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 230 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the small processing track are currently averaging 1,085 days, medium processing track are currently averaging 1,310 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,010 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,370 days for processing.

Your request is currently in the [complex] request [large] processing track, and the estimated date of completion for your request is [September, 2026].  If your request is considered a complex track, considering reducing the scope of your request may accelerate the process as it could potentially place your request in a quicker processing track.  This may also reduce any search and duplication costs, if applicable, and allow for a more timely receipt of your information.

If you wish to discuss reducing the scope of your request, please indicate so and a representative will be in contact.


Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All email correspondence, with attachments, mentioning "Water Property Investors," "Water Property Investor II," or "Water Property Investor III." 

2. Pitch decks, prospectuses, or any other materials provided to NMERB by the the above funds for consideration of potential investments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Julia Rock

communications.subject: Fw: [EXTERNAL] New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Records Requestor:


Your request for information from the New Mexico Educational Retirement Board was forwarded to me. In accordance with the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA), “a written request shall provide the name, address and telephone number of the person seeking access to the records and shall identify the records sought with reasonable particularity.” Section 14-2-8(C) NMSA 1978.


If you will provide me with your name and mailing address, we can begin the process of allowing inspection of the relevant records.


The Inspection of Public Records Act can be found at 14-2-1 through 14-2-12 NMSA 1978.


Thank you.


Amanda Olsen



Amanda Olsen, Paralegal
NM Educational Retirement Board
PO Box 26129
Santa Fe, New Mexico 87502

(505) 827-8030 fax

Subject: [EXTERNAL] New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence



CAUTION: This email originated outside of our organization. Exercise caution prior to clicking on links or opening attachments.

New Mexico Educational Retirement Board
IPRA Office
701 Camino De Los Marquez
Santa Fe, NM 87505

June 5, 2023

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All email correspondence, with attachments, mentioning "Water Property Investors," "Water Property Investor II," or "Water Property Investor III."

2. Pitch decks, prospectuses, or any other materials provided to NMERB by the the above funds for consideration of potential investments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Julia Rock

Dear Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for your response! My name is Rebecca Burns and my colleague Julia Rock and I are reporters at The Lever, a national investigative outlet. I am making this request as part of ongoing reporting into water issues in the American West. This request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

My mailing address is 4521 N Central Park Ave. 3W, Chicago IL 60625. My phone number is 781-962-8816. Please feel free to give me a call if it's helpful to discuss any portion of this request. 

Thank you!

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Scroggins and Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for the update. Can you provide any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request, or the estimated delivery date? Please feel free to give me a call at 781-962-8816 if it'd be helpful to discuss the scope of the materials we're requesting.

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock,

I am responding to your email yesterday requesting any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request. Please be assured that we make every effort to respond promptly to every request. However, we must also ensure that we are diligent and accurate in our reply. Thus, when obtained, all documents and emails must be reviewed. Additionally, we must rely on the state agency that controls the entire state email system to identify and provide the emails requested. As you can imagine, the process takes time.

As to an estimated response date, in our letter of August 1, 2023, we noted that we intend to respond by September 6, 2023.

Thank you for your patience and please feel free to contact me if you have further questions.

Respectfully,

[cid:image001.png@01D9C623.0D3F7D80]

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Garcia,

Thank you for the update. Given that it's now been five months since we filed the initial request, are you able to provide an update as to whether you've identified the responsive documents, or what the source of the delay is?

Thank you,

Rebecca

communications.subject: ATTORNEY CLIENT PRIVILEGED - RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

Thank you for your inquiry and please accept our apologies for the delay.

As Mr. Scroggins noted in his August 3, 2023 email regarding our projected response, we always try to be prompt.  But as you might guess, the request references a large number of records.  As he said, we must thoroughly review all records to identify and obtain the responsive documents from both external and internal sources.  It is a complex and time-consuming process.

I am confident that we will have documents ready to provide on or before the December 6th, 2023, date noted in our recent communication.

Thank you for your continued patience!
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image002.png@01DA121F.C2136CB0]

Sincerely,
Julia Rock

communications.subject: Re: Request for Inspection of Records
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns:

As discussed in our letter of December 6, 2023, we are providing the records we currently have available in response to your June 16, 2023, request.  They are located at the website below:

MuckRock - Julia Rock<https://nmgov-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/renee_garcia_erb_nm_gov/Documents/MuckRock%20-%20Julia%20Rock?csf=1&web=1&e=4gwfSH>

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records.  We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024.  Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image001.png@01DA29F0.5D899B00]

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Agency Roster (Miami Gardens Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: Records Request Confirmation
communications.communication:
Thank you for submitting a request for records to City of Miami Gardens

Your request security key is CD4CDB51.
Your request reference number is Request Number: PD-4625-2024.

Please have this security key and reference number available when communicating with our staff regarding your request. 
  
 In accordance with Chapter 119 of the Florida Statutes, this is to acknowledge our receipt of your Public Records Request.   
  
 We are in receipt of your public records request pursuant to Chapter 119 of the Florida Statues. We are diligently working to provide you with a response. All public records request are handled on a first come first serve basis and responded to promptly once the records have been retrieved, reviewed, and redacted if necessary to prevent confidential or exempt information from being disclosed.  If there is a cost associated with your request, an estimate will be provided. Payment is due in order to begin processing the request when necessary. 
  
 Pursuant to Section §119.07(4)(d), F.S., if the nature or volume of the public records requested to be inspected, examined or copied is such as to require extensive use of information technology resources or extensive clerical or supervisory assistance by personnel, or both, a special service charge in addition to the actual cost of duplication will be assessed, except for law enforcement agencies.     
  
 If your request is too broad to identify any particular set of records, a representative may contact you to discuss if it can be revised to be more specific.  In addition, Florida’s public records law obligates agencies to provide copies of public records and does not obligate agencies to create records or answer questions.    
  
 Your understanding of this process is greatly appreciated.  If you require additional information, please contact the Office of the City Clerk at (305) 622-8000. 
  
 Thank you! 
  
 City of Miami Gardens 
  
 Office of the City Clerk 
  
 18605 NW 27th Avenue, Miami Gardens, FL 33056 
  
 Main: (305) 622-8000 | records@miamigardens-fl.gov 
  
 www.miamigardens-fl.gov

title: IHSC SENs & SIRs - Pulmonary Embolism Referrals

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: IHSC SENs & SIRs - Pulmonary Embolism Referrals
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. ICE ERO All Significant Event Notifications (SENs) and Significant Incident Reports (SIRs) created by ERO Field Office detention staff or Immigrant ICE Health Services Corps (IHSC) staff and transmitted to IHSC’s Medical Quality Management Unit or other custodians responsible for monitoring the quality and timeliness of detained immigrants’s care in custody, between January 1, 2021, and the present, that satisfy all of the following criteria: 
(a) Detainee - Involves a detained immigrant in any U.S. ICE facility; 
(b) Needing Care — Who required emergent care, chronic care, or a referral for a higher level of care; 
(c) Based on DVT or PE or Clot — For one or more of the following conditions, whether a formal diagnosis exists or not: (i) deep vein thrombophlebitis (DVT); (ii) pulmonary thromboembelism; _or_ (iii) blood clot. 

Please provide electronic database entries as printouts in PDF format. 

2. All IHSC or ERO SENs and SIRs relating to medical issues at the Aurora ICE Processing Center just outside Denver, Colorado, created between April 2022 and the present (which, under applicable FOIA law, means ‘the date on which the agency tasks an adequate search’). 

3. Any record showing the number of chronic care patients, special medical needs, or significant detainee illness patients IHSC Headquarters or the IHSC Regional Health Services Administrator was aware of on the morning of October 12, 2022. We will accept a total number in lieu of a redacted list. 

Pursuant to 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e), behalf of the Al Otro Lado #DetentionKills Transparency Initiative and community partners representing individuals detained at Aurora, we respectfully seek expedited processing of this request, and make the following statement under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 USC 1746: 
A. On October 14, 2022, ICE announced the death of a 39 year-old man inside Aurora ICE Processing Center. 
B. ICE subsequently posted a Detainee Death Report describing his medical treatment and care at Aurora. 
C. In the wake of his death, significant questions have arisen as to the safety and appropriateness of the medical services he received in the weeks preceding it. 
D. These concerns directly impact humans currently imprisoned inside AIPC, and the medical system serving it. 
E. Failure to obtain timely, comprehensive information on IHSC and ICE’s capacity to ensure timely and appropriate medical care may put the health and safety of people inside at further risk. 
F. The case has been the subject of widespread media attention, and Congressional demands for preservation of records and a thorough, independent investigation. 

Accordingly, we respectfully request expedited processing of this request. 

Thank you, 

#DetentionKills Transparency Initiative
Al Otro Lado

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

All IHSC or ERO SENs and SIRs relating to medical issues at the Aurora ICE Processing Center just outside Denver, Colorado, created between April 2022 and the present (which, under applicable FOIA law, means ‘the date on which the agency tasks an adequate search’).3. Any record showing the number of chronic care patients, special medical needs, or significant detainee illness patients IHSC Headquarters or the IHSC Regional Health Services Administrator was aware of on the morning of October 12, 2022. We will accept a total number in lieu of a redacted list..  Your request was received in this office on 11/14/2022.Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request. Per Section 5.5(a) of the DHS FOIA regulations, 6 C.F.R. Part 5, ICE processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt. Although ICE’s goal is to respond within 20 business days of receipt of your request, the FOIA does permit a 10-day extension of this time period. As your request seeks numerous documents that will necessitate a thorough and wide-ranging search, ICE will invoke a 10-day extension for your request, as allowed by Title 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B). If you’re able to narrow the scope of your request please contact our office. Narrowing the scope may speed up the search process. We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner.Provisions of the FOIA allow us to recover part of the cost of complying with your request.  We shall charge you for records in accordance with the DHS Interim FOIA regulations as they apply to non-commercial requesters.  As a non-commercial requester, you will be charged 10 cents per page for duplication; the first 100 pages are free, as are the first two hours of search time, after which you will pay the per quarter-hour rate ($4.00 for clerical personnel, $7.00 for professional personnel, $10.25 for managerial personnel) of the searcher.  We will construe the submission of your request as an agreement to pay up to $25.00. You will be contacted before any further fees are accrued.We have queried the appropriate program offices within ICE for responsive records. If any responsive records are located, they will be reviewed for determination of releasability. Please be assured that one of the processors in our office will respond to your request as expeditiously as possible. We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request.If you have any questions, please contact FOIA Public Liaison, Marcus Francis at the address above or (866) 633-1182. Additionally, you have a right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974.  You may contact OGIS as follows:  Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769.Your request has been assigned reference number 2023-ICFO-03979. Please use this number in future correspondence. Sincerely,ICE FOIA OfficeImmigration and Customs EnforcementFreedom of Information Act Office500 12th Street, S.W., Stop 5009Washington, D.C. 20536-5009

RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2023-ICFO-03979 
 
Dear Requester: 

This acknowledges receipt of your 11/14/2022, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), for All Significant Event Notifications (SENs) and Significant Incident Reports (SIRs) created by ERO Field Office detention staff or Immigrant ICE Health Services Corps (IHSC) staff and transmitted to IHSC’s Medical Quality Management Unit or other custodians responsible for monitoring the quality and timeliness of detained immigrants’s care in custody, between January 1, 2021, and the present, that satisfy all of the following criteria: 
(a) Detainee - Involves a detained immigrant in any U.S. ICE facility; 
(b) Needing Care — Who required emergent care, chronic care, or a referral for a higher level of care; 
(c) Based on DVT or PE or Clot — For one or more of the following conditions, whether a formal diagnosis exists or not: (i) deep vein thrombophlebitis (DVT); (ii) pulmonary thromboembelism; _or_ (iii) blood clot. 

2. All IHSC or ERO SENs and SIRs relating to medical issues at the Aurora ICE Processing Center just outside Denver, Colorado, created between April 2022 and the present (which, under applicable FOIA law, means ‘the date on which the agency tasks an adequate search’). 

3. Any record showing the number of chronic care patients, special medical needs, or significant detainee illness patients IHSC Headquarters or the IHSC Regional Health Services Administrator was aware of on the morning of October 12, 2022. We will accept a total number in lieu of a redacted list. Your request was received in this office on 11/14/2022. 

By letter, dated12/22/2022, we advised you that due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we could encounter some delay in processing your request. We sincerely apologize for the delay and any inconvenience it may have caused. 

Before we begin the time-consuming review process, we want to ensure that you are still interested in continuing the processing of this request. Please indicate your continued interest in pursuing these records within 30 days from the date of this letter, or we will assume you are no longer interested in this FOIA request, and the case will be administratively closed.

communications.subject: ICE FOIA 2023-ICFO-03979
communications.communication:
Andrew Free 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR136823 
263 Huntington Ave 
Boston, Massachusetts 02115 

RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2023-ICFO-03979 

Dear Requester: 

This letter is the final response to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), dated 11/14/2022.  You have requested All Significant Event Notifications (SENs) and Significant Incident Reports (SIRs) created by ERO Field Office detention staff or Immigrant ICE Health Services Corps (IHSC) staff and transmitted to IHSC’s Medical Quality Management Unit or other custodians responsible for monitoring the quality and timeliness of detained immigrants care in custody, between January 1, 2021, and the present, that satisfy all of the following criteria: (a) Detainee - Involves a detained immigrant in any U.S. ICE facility; (b) Needing Care — Who required emergent care, chronic care, or a referral for a higher level of care; (c) Based on DVT or PE or Clot — For one or more of the following conditions, whether a formal diagnosis exists or not: (i) deep vein thrombophlebitis (DVT); (ii) pulmonary thromboembelism; _or_ (iii) blood clot. 

2. All IHSC or ERO SENs and SIRs relating to medical issues at the Aurora ICE Processing Center just outside Denver, Colorado, created between April 2022 and the present (which, under applicable FOIA law, means ‘the date on which the agency tasks an adequate search’). 

3. Any record showing the number of chronic care patients, special medical needs, or significant detainee illness patients IHSC Headquarters or the IHSC Regional Health Services Administrator was aware of on the morning of October 12, 2022. We will accept a total number in lieu of a redacted list.. ICE has considered your request under the FOIA, 5 U.S.C. § 552. 

ICE considered the foreseeable harm standard when reviewing the record set and has applied the FOIA exemptions as required by the statute and the Attorney General’s Guidance. 

A search of the ICE Office of Enforcement and Removal Operations (ERO) for records responsive to your request produced 65 pages that are responsive to your request.  After review of those documents, I have determined portions of 59 pages will be withheld pursuant to Exemptions of the FOIA as described below. 

ICE has applied FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7(C) to protect from disclosure the names, e-mail addresses, and phone numbers of DHS employees, as well as other third-party information contained within the documents. 

FOIA Exemption 6 exempts from disclosure personnel or medical files and similar files the release of which would cause a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy.  This requires a balancing of the public’s right to disclosure against the individual’s right to privacy.  The privacy interests of the individuals in the records you have requested outweigh any minimal public interest in disclosure of the information.  Any private interest you may have in that information does not factor into the aforementioned balancing test. 

FOIA Exemption 7(C) protects records or information compiled for law enforcement purposes that could reasonably be expected to constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy.  This exemption takes particular note of the strong interests of individuals, whether they are suspects, witnesses, or investigators, in not being unwarrantably associated with alleged criminal activity.  That interest extends to persons who are not only the subjects of the investigation, but those who may have their privacy invaded by having their identities and information about them revealed in connection with an investigation.  Based upon the traditional recognition of strong privacy interest in law enforcement records, categorical withholding of information that identifies third parties in law enforcement records is ordinarily appropriate.  As such, I have determined that the privacy interest in the identities of individuals in the records you have requested clearly outweigh any minimal public interest in disclosure of the information.  Please note that any private interest you may have in that information does not factor into this determination. 

ICE has applied FOIA Exemption 7(E) to protect from disclosure internal agency case numbers and internal agency URLs contained within the document. 

FOIA Exemption 7(E) protects records compiled for law enforcement purposes, the release of which would disclose techniques and/or procedures for law enforcement investigations or prosecutions, or would disclose guidelines for law enforcement investigations or prosecutions if such disclosure could reasonably be expected to risk circumvention of the law.  I have determined that disclosure of certain law enforcement sensitive information contained within the responsive records could reasonably be expected to risk circumvention of the law.  Additionally, the techniques and procedures at issue are not well known to the public. 

You have a right to appeal the above withholding determination.  Should you wish to do so, you must send your appeal and a copy of this letter, within 90 days of the date of this letter following the procedures outlined in the DHS FOIA regulations at 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.8. You may submit your appeal electronically at GILDFOIAAppeals@ice.dhs.gov or via regular mail to: 

U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement 
Office of the Principal Legal Advisor 
U.S. Department of Homeland Security 
500 12th Street, S.W., Mail Stop 5900 
Washington, D.C. 20536-5900 

Your envelope and letter should be marked “FOIA Appeal.”  Copies of the FOIA and DHS regulations are available at www.dhs.gov/foia. 

Provisions of FOIA allow DHS to charge for processing fees, up to $25, unless you seek a waiver of fees.  In this instance, because the cost is below the $25 minimum, there is no charge. 

If you have any questions please contact FOIA Public Liaison Daniel Edgington at (866) 633-1182 or 500 12th St., SW Stop 5009 Washington, DC 20536-5009.  Additionally, you have a right to right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974.  You may contact OGIS as follows:  Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448. 

Sincerely, 

Angela Flores 
Supervisory Paralegal Specialist 

ICE FOIA Office 
Immigration and Customs Enforcement 
Freedom of Information Act Office 
500 12th Street, S.W., Stop 5009 
Washington, D.C. 20536-5009 

Enclosure(s):	65 Pages 
Note: If you are receiving this message by email and responsive records are not included as an attachment to the email, please log in to your SecureRelease portal account to view the responsive records.

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: C023479-110724
communications.communication:
Dear Joey Scott, Thank you for submitting a request for public records to the City of Long Beach. Pursuant to California Government Code § 7920.000, staff will review your request and respond within 10 days to notify you if there are responsive records, or if an extension is necessary to determine whether responsive records exist. 
If your request was received after business hours or on a weekend or holiday, the next business day will be considered the date of receipt. The 10-day response period starts with the first calendar day after the date of receipt (Ca. Civ. Code, § 10). 
 
If you have any questions, please call (562) 570-6680. 
 Sincerely,

title: PACKAGE THEFT DATA IN MAJOR METROPOLITAN AREAS

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: PACKAGE THEFT DATA IN MAJOR METROPOLITAN AREAS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Following the Freedom of Information Act, I request access to records related to package theft trends across major U.S. metropolitan areas. Specially, I seek the following:

1. Statistics on reported package thefts from Seattle, San Diego, Los Angeles, New York City, Chicago, Austin, Denver and Portland between January 1, 2019, and the present.
2. Policies and protocols for investigating package theft involving USPS deliveries.
3. Communication or agreements between the USPS Postal Inspection Service and local police departments regarding theft investigations and prevention.
4. Public outreach materials or initiatives addressing package theft prevention.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Abby Feldman

communications.subject: 2025-IGFP-00055 Feldman, Abby Acknowledgment
communications.communication:
Dera Ms. Feldman:

This acknowledges receipt of your October 24 Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) to the U.S. Postal Service Office of Inspector General (OIG) request for records related to package theft trends across major U.S. metropolitan areas. Specially, your requested:


  1.  Statistics on reported package thefts from Seattle, San Diego, Los Angeles, New York City, Chicago, Austin, Denver and Portland between January 1, 2019, and the present.
  2.  Policies and protocols for investigating package theft involving USPS deliveries.
  3.  Communication or agreements between the USPS Postal Inspection Service and local police departments regarding theft investigations and prevention.
  4.  Public outreach materials or initiatives addressing package theft prevention.

The OIG FOIA case number shown in the subject line above has been assigned to your request. Your request will be processed in the order it was received.

The FOIA provides agencies 20 working days from receipt to respond to requesters. While this office routinely meets this requirement, current workloads may require additional time to provide our final response.

The FOIA is about records we have in our possession. The FOIA provides only for disclosing federal agency records and does not require government agencies to answer questions, conduct unreasonably burdensome research, or create records. FOIA does not let you appeal any investigative decisions or ask us to research aside from searching for responsive records.

The FOIA sheds light on an agency’s performance of its statutory duties. The FOIA provides that any person has a right, enforceable in court, to obtain access to federal agency records, unless such records (or portions of them) are protected from public disclosure by one of nine exemptions or by one of three special law enforcement record exclusions.

The U.S. Postal Service comprises the Postal Service, the U.S. Postal Inspection Service (USPIS); the Postal Rate Commission (PRC); and the OIG; each with its own area of responsibility and individual FOIA office. This acknowledgment is on behalf of the OIG only.

The Postal Service Records Office establishes procedures to ensure Postal Service records management practices comply with both the FOIA and Privacy Act. The Records Office is the designated custodian for non-law enforcement Postal Service records; including but not limited to contracting and employment/personnel records. Additional information regarding the Postal Service FOIA program can be found at https://about.usps.com/who-we-are/foia/welcome.htm.

The USPIS is the law enforcement, crime prevention, and security arm of USPS, and is the designated custodian for postal records relating to Postal Service law enforcement issues. The USPIS is a federal law enforcement entity charged with enforcing the Federal statutes involving mail fraud, illegal drugs, external mail theft, and other postal crimes, including revenue deficiencies, and are responsible for safety and security of all postal employees and facilities. Additional information regarding the USPIS FOIA program can be found at Terms of Service and Legal | USPIS<https://www.uspis.gov/terms-of-service#freedom-of-information-act>.

The OIG is an independent agency, created in 1997, with oversight authority over audits and investigations of Postal and Inspection Service fraud, abuse, and misconduct. The OIG’s mission is to prevent, detect, and report fraud, theft, and misconduct, and promote efficiency in the operation of the Postal Service.

While the OIG has “oversight authority” for activities of the above referenced entities, the OIG is a separate agency and does not have management authority over the daily operations of either the Postal Service or USPIS. In addition, the OIG FOIA office does not have access to records maintained by the Postal Service or UPSIS and cannot direct either FOIA office to release records under their control. Likewise, the OIG Deputy General Counsel has no authority to review FOIA determinations issued by the Postal Service or USPIS.

Because records related to external mail theft are maintained by the USPIS, we are forwarding a copy of your request to their FOIA office. They will issue a separate FOIA case number and respond to you directly. If you have questions regarding this referral, please contact them via email at foia@uspis.gov<mailto:foia@uspis.gov>, or in writing at:

Office of Counsel
U.S. Postal Inspection Service FOIA/PA Unit
475 L'Enfant Plaza, SW, Room 3301
Washington, DC  20260

Sincerely,

USPS OIG FOIA Team

title: Agency Roster (Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Agency Roster (Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of November 04, 2024, Agency Tracker # W210160-110424. 
Dear Marcus Boyd, 
Your request dated 11/4/2024 has been received in this office. In accordance with Chapter 119.07(1), Florida Statutes and Section 1.7, Internal Management Policies and Procedures of the Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission we have reviewed your request. 
Due to the size of your request, this will take extensive staff time to complete. Pursuant to Section 119.07(4)(d), Florida Statutes, and Section 1.7, Internal Management Policies and Procedures of the Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission, I have compiled an estimate of the associated charges, as indicated in your electronic invoice. 
For your convenience you can now go online and pay for your records in the request portal. 
If you wish to pay via check, please submit a check payable to the Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission. You may mail your check, with a copy of this invoice, to the Finance and Accounting Section, 620 South Meridian Street, Tallahassee, Florida 32399. Once we have received payment, we will begin processing your request. For State Agencies, please reach out to us for the appropriate Journal Transfer Information. 
Since this is an estimate, should we find that additional charges apply, you will be advised in advance. Should this estimate exceed the time required, you will be eligible for a refund. If you require further assistance, please let us know. 
Sincerely, 
Samantha Ganey

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of November 04, 2024, Agency Tracker # W210160-110424. 
Dear Marcus Boyd, 
Your request dated 11/4/2024 has been received in this office. In accordance with Chapter 119.07(1), Florida Statutes and Section 1.7, Internal Management Policies and Procedures of the Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission we have reviewed your request. 
Due to the size of your request, this will take extensive staff time to complete. Pursuant to Section 119.07(4)(d), Florida Statutes, and Section 1.7, Internal Management Policies and Procedures of the Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission, I have compiled an estimate of the associated charges, as indicated in your electronic invoice. 
For your convenience you can now go online and pay for your records in the request portal. 
If you wish to pay via check, please submit a check payable to the Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission. You may mail your check, with a copy of this invoice, to the Finance and Accounting Section, 620 South Meridian Street, Tallahassee, Florida 32399. Once we have received payment, we will begin processing your request. For State Agencies, please reach out to us for the appropriate Journal Transfer Information. 
Since this is an estimate, should we find that additional charges apply, you will be advised in advance. Should this estimate exceed the time required, you will be eligible for a refund. If you require further assistance, please let us know. 
Sincerely, 
Samantha Ganey

title: Zenna Ramos Do Not Call List

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Zenna Ramos Do Not Call List
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Any and all documents pertaining to the addition and removal of Zenna Ramos to the CCSAO’s Brady/Giglio/Do Not Call lists

Some information regarding this occurrence is referenced here:
https://capitolfax.com/2023/08/24/zenna-ramos-was-placed-on-the-states-attorneys-do-not-call-list-after-the-illinois-law-enforcement-training-and-standards-board-decertified-her/

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Edmund Burke

title: RTK 07/17 Butler County ESU c/o District Attorney

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: RTK 07/17 Butler County ESU c/o District Attorney
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A roster of all employees of the Butler County Emergency Services Unit (ESU), including but not limited to first name, last name, position, badge number, salary, and date of hire.
2. All emails, text messages, call logs, and/or other communications among members of the Butler County ESU and between the department and other local, state and federal agencies regarding the rally, held on July 13, 2024, for former President Donald J. Trump at the Butler Farm Show. Please provide communications that occurred any time between January 1, 2024 and the date of this request.
3. All invoices, memoranda of understanding or other such agreements showing and/or describing the services the ESU provided for the rally.
4. All overtime requests submitted by the ESU for hours worked on July 13, 2024 and July 14, 2024.
5. Documents showing active shooter protocols for the ESU, including documents outlining any training department employees have taken in the past five years.


The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Danielle Ohl
